Facsimile Images

Ἀρχηγέτει εὐχὴ Ἡρακλεῖ Θαλλοφόρῳ
ἱερῷ εὐαπσεστάτωα < Λ(ούκιος)> Κορνήλιος Λ(ουκίου)
Κορνηλίου υἱὸς ΠΑΝ Τερεντιανὸς
καὶ Λήμνιος ἀπελεύθερος ἐποίησαν
5Π Π

Apparatus criticus

Text based on comparison of Kaibel, Filippi and SEG, prioritising Kaibel's transcription of the manuscript tradition.; ΠΑΝ: perhaps for either Γαλ(ερια) Παλ(ατινα) (so Tybout, ap. SEG)
5: ΠΠ: perhaps for p(ecunia) p(osuit) or p(ropria) p(ecunia) (so Tybout, ap. SEG)

translation

commentary

As Korhonen lucidly details, the inscription is one of a series of late 18th century local antiquarian forgeries, constructed on the basis of existing texts, principally those to be found in the 1769 first edition of the corpus of Torremuzza. In the specific case of this inscription, De Bernardin noted this already in 2012. Kaibel classed the entire series already as forgeries in IG XIV.

  • Filippi 2005 69 no. 15/5 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002296
  • De Bernardin 2012 307-308 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002297
  • Korhonen 2017 198 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001484
